title: Monoline display face
content:
I’m attempting to track down this geometric monoline display face (or something similar). Given it’s simplicity, I have a hunch that it’s a custom job built from outlines. It’s currently being used by for product branding by Zoom, a Japanese music accessory manufacturer.

[http://www.zoom.co.jp/english/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905020035/http:/www.zoom.co.jp/english/ "http://www.zoom.co.jp/english/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905020035im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Untitled-2_5550.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905020035im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/2310273735_9f4b225591_4004.jpg)

Any help would be appreciated.

g.

 [‹ A diplomat is a person who...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905020035/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43113 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help identifying old school german type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905020035/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43124 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Grant Hutchinson

comments.content:
Here’s a better sample of the characters in the above photo:

[http://skitch.com/blanco/88kc/control-package](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905020035/http:/skitch.com/blanco/88kc/control-package "http://skitch.com/blanco/88kc/control-package")

Nevermind.

It has been determined from the company in Japan that this is a custom, in house typeface.
Thanks, Carlos. I have passed those examples along to the designer as well.
